basic_info.description: I'm Kyle, and I am a software developer currently studying at Code Fellows.  Prior to this I did my best work in healthcare tech, spending 7 years in increasingly complex analyst and IT support roles.  I chose to pursue software development because the most fun I've ever had professionally has been working with engineering to implement the product team's designs.  I am certain that having lived in the support and product worlds gives me invaluable context for software design that I could only gain by first hand experience. I would like to use my powers for good and go back into healthcare tech at a small or medium sized company.  It is very important to me that the work I do could be helping someone who is struggling.  Thanks for your time.

projects.title: Layoffs - the Game
projects.description: A simple JavaScript browser game where the player quickly chooses to hire or fire an employee based on a SVG performance chart, and saves results to a leaderboard.  First ever group project as a developer with Code Fellows.  With 3 weeks experience, this was my first ever group project while learning to code! Built with HTML, CSS and Javascript, utilizing Chart.js and localStorage methods for leaderboard results.

projects.title: Tabletop Visualizer
projects.description: Personal project for myself and other tabletop gamers to figure out how much space game night is going to take up. A tool that renders a mockup of the physical footprint of a board game for a given number of players and table size. In progress personal project.  TODO:Built with list, tech used, languages, frameworks, libraries, individual cloud services.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: The very first student project I made while at Code Fellows, made with between 1-2 weeks hands on experience.  A mock storefront for a disgusting bakery intended to teach the very basics of JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
